page.title: 07Road Transport in Cattistock
page.content: Cattistock is nine miles from the nearest town. Majority of households own at least one car. Many under-21's now also own cars and young people often ride motorbikes. Elderly people rely largely on public transport. Family-owned garage in the village provides an excellent bus service, petrol and servicing for cars. Daily services to Dorchester, Yeovil and Bridport, weekly service to Sherborne. School buses to Maiden Newton (primary) and Beaminster (secondary); but scant public transport to Beaminster out of school hours. No evening or Sunday services; no old age pensioner fare concessions, but general subsidized fares. Bus company provides day trips, holidays in England and abroad, and visits to sports and theatres.
